paper_abstract: This paper presents a new parallel algorithm, called "block-based wavefront", to produce optimal pairwise alignment for biological sequences with reliable output and reasonable cost. It takes advantage of dynamic programming and parallel computing to produce optimal results in reasonable time. More importantly, the algorithm makes it possible for biologists to analyze datasets that were previously considered too long, often leading to memory overflow or prohibitively long time for computation.
paper_title: Parallel computing for optimal genomic sequence alignment
